pybpl.relation module¶

pybpl.library module¶

The library module contains a Library class (and its dependencies) for loading the hyperparameters of a pre-fit BPL model. This is designed primarily for the Omniglot use case, enabling the transfer of parameters from the matlab BPL repo (see https://github.com/brendenlake/BPL).

Holds all parameters of the conditional probability distribution. These parameters have been learned from the training data.

class pybpl.library.Library(lib_dir=None, use_hist=False)¶

Bases: object

LIBRARY: hyper-parameters for the BPL model

Parameters

  • lib_dir (string) – path to the library files

  • use_hist (bool) – if true, the original BPL spatial histogram model will be used. The default (False) uses a new, differentiable spatial distribution

pT(prev_state)¶

Get the probability of transitioning to a new state, given your current state is “prev_state”

Parameters

prev_state (tensor) – current state of the model

Returns

p – probability vector; probabilities of transitioning to each potential new state

class pybpl.library.SpatialModel(xlim, ylim, clump_ID)¶

Bases: object

Use specific distributions if 0 <= part_ID < clump_ID, or a clump clump distribution if part_ID >= clump_ID.

  • clump_ID (int) – part index at which we begin clumping
